definition: wishing one could do sth/to hate to be unable/itching to do sth
to hate/to regret
(negative prefix)/not/no
to obtain/to get/to gain/to catch (a disease)/proper/suitable/proud/contented/to allow/to permit/ready/finished
structural particle: used after a verb (or adjective as main verb), linking it to following phrase indicating effect, degree, possibility etc
to have to/must/ought to/to need to

sentences.english: Standing there in the office, miserable, I wanted to vanish into the paneling.
sentences.chinese: 我伤心地站在办公室门口，恨不得消失在门缝里。

sentences.english: Sam longed for the oblivion of sleep.
sentences.chinese: 萨姆恨不得一睡不醒，了无心事。

sentences.english: More over, when a woman wants to have a romantic relationship, men should come, and they would.
sentences.chinese: 想到此恨不得中国人口男女比例再失调些。

sentences.english: When I saw this tree, I wanted to kick it out of the door and down the street.
sentences.chinese: 我一看到这棵树，就恨不得把它踹出门滚到大街上。

sentences.english: He couldn t see his girlfriend fast enough.
sentences.chinese: 他恨不得马上见到他的女朋友。

sentences.english: Standing there in the office, miserable, I wanted to vanish into the paneling .
sentences.chinese: 我伤心地站在办公室门口，恨不得消失在门缝里。

sentences.english: Madam's facial expression of that Liu's mansion heaves red, quite anxious to seek a ground aperture to drill into.
sentences.chinese: 那刘府的夫人脸色涨红，恨不得找个地洞钻进去。

sentences.english: Soon my arm was about a mile down the heat vent.
sentences.chinese: 很快我的手臂就恨不得向暖风管里伸进去一里地。

sentences.english: Kibo: good, Can't wait to see them.
sentences.chinese: 好的，恨不得马上就看到。

sentences.english: How I wish I could go there right now.
Liu Qing hates not immediately said would accept the job.
sentences.chinese: 刘清恨不得马上就说愿意接受这份工作。

sentences.english: After long journey, we wish once red-hot water bath.
sentences.chinese: 经过长途跋涉，大家恨不得立刻冲个热水澡。

sentences.english: I plastered myself to the wall, hoping to disappear into shadow.
sentences.chinese: 我紧紧地贴着墙，恨不得能够消失在阴影当中。

sentences.english: Sometimes I wish I was a hobo.
sentences.chinese: 哼，我真恨不得去当个流浪汉。

sentences.english: In times of need, Japanese say they can even ask the cat for help.
sentences.chinese: 在劳动力短缺时期，日本人说他们恨不得让猫来帮忙。

sentences.english: One fell hard enough to break the glider's sturdy aluminum strut.
sentences.chinese: 人们都恨不得折断滑翔机上那段坚硬的铝支杆。

definition: see 恨不得[hen4 bu5 de5]
(coll.) to be eager for/to long for/to look forward to
to get really angry
gnashing one's teeth (idiom); displaying extreme anger/fuming with rage between gritted teeth
to itch/to tickle
to blow one's top/to be driven mad/to become frantic
regardless of the consequences/recklessly relying on a hopelessly optimistic forecast

definition: to get angry/to burn with rage
to throttle/to choke to death
not saying anything further (idiom); not raising any objection/without demur
to fear/afraid/extremely nervous/for fear that/to avoid/so as not to
half dead (of torment, hunger, tiredness etc)/(tired) to death/(terrified) out of one's wits/(beaten) to within an inch of one's life/(knock) the daylights out of sb
to hate bitterly
to hate to do sth/to hate to part with/to begrudge
extremely/awfully
to burst with joy (idiom)/to be over the moon/to be elated
